price_objection.objection: Your price is higher than the other quotes I got
price_objection.right_approach: I appreciate you being upfront about that. Can I ask what the other quotes included? Often we find we're comparing different scopes - like [SPECIFIC EXAMPLES: warranty length, equipment tier, included services]. Let me show you exactly what you're getting and why, then you can make an apples-to-apples comparison.
price_objection.psychology: Customers want to understand value, not just see lower numbers. Educate rather than defend.

timing_objection.objection: I need to think about it / I'm not ready to decide today
timing_objection.wrong_approach: Pressuring with artificial urgency or limited-time discounts
timing_objection.right_approach: I completely understand - this is a significant decision. What specific questions or concerns do you need to think through? I'd rather address those now than have you wondering about them. Also, what's your timeline for making this happen?
timing_objection.psychology: Usually means they have unresolved concerns, not that they need time. Uncover the real hesitation.

trust_objection.objection: How do I know you'll actually do what you say?
trust_objection.right_approach: That's a fair question - you don't know me yet. Here's what I can offer: [SPECIFIC REFERENCES from your neighborhood], our [SPECIFIC WARRANTY/GUARANTEE], and [VERIFIABLE CREDENTIALS]. Plus, we don't get paid until you're satisfied. What would make you feel confident moving forward?
trust_objection.psychology: Trust is earned through specificity, proof, and risk reversal, not claims.

diy_objection.objection: I'm pretty handy - I might just fix it myself
diy_objection.right_approach: I respect that - many homeowners are capable. The challenges with HVAC are [SPECIFIC TECHNICAL ISSUES: refrigerant certification requirements, diagnostic equipment needs, warranty implications]. Plus, if the diagnosis is wrong, you could spend money on parts that don't fix it. How about we diagnose it properly, then you can decide?
diy_objection.psychology: Respect their competence while highlighting legitimate complexity and risk.

repair_vs_replace_objection.objection: Can't we just repair it instead of replacing?
repair_vs_replace_objection.right_approach: Let's look at this together. Your system is [AGE] years old, the repair costs $[AMOUNT], and based on the issue, you're likely looking at [ADDITIONAL REPAIRS] in the near future. Here's the math: repair now plus likely repairs equals $[TOTAL] for a system that's already past typical lifespan. A new system gives you [SPECIFIC BENEFITS]. Which makes more sense for your situation?
repair_vs_replace_objection.psychology: Show the math transparently and let them reach the conclusion themselves.

multiple_quote_objection.objection: I want to get a few more quotes before deciding
multiple_quote_objection.wrong_approach: Trying to prevent them from shopping around
multiple_quote_objection.right_approach: Absolutely - you should feel confident in your decision. When you're comparing quotes, make sure you're looking at: [SPECIFIC COMPARISON POINTS: equipment model numbers, SEER ratings, warranty terms, what's included in installation]. Can I answer any questions that will help you compare accurately?
multiple_quote_objection.psychology: Embrace shopping behavior and educate them on how to evaluate properly - positions you as advisor.

brand_objection.objection: I've heard [BRAND] is better than what you're recommending
brand_objection.right_approach: [BRAND] makes good equipment. Here's why I'm recommending [YOUR BRAND] for your situation: [SPECIFIC REASONS: better match for home size, superior warranty, better parts availability locally, our technicians' expertise]. The truth is, proper installation matters more than brand - a great system installed poorly performs worse than a good system installed right.
brand_objection.psychology: Validate their research while redirecting to what actually matters - installation quality and fit.

educational.title: Why Your AC Freezes Up in Summer
educational.hook: Your AC is frozen solid... in 95-degree weather? Here's why.
educational.body: When your evaporator coil freezes, it's usually one of three things: dirty air filter blocking airflow, low refrigerant from a leak, or a failing blower motor. The ice isn't cooling your home - it's blocking it. First, turn off your AC and let it thaw for 2-3 hours. Check your filter. If it's clogged, replace it. Turn your system back on. Still freezing? You've got a refrigerant leak or mechanical issue that needs a pro.
educational.cta: Don't let a frozen AC leave you sweating. Call us for same-day diagnostics. Link in bio.

educational.title: The $20 Fix That Prevents $3,000 Repairs
educational.hook: This $20 part failing will cost you $3,000. Here's how to avoid it.
educational.body: Your AC capacitor is a small cylinder that starts your compressor and fan motors. It costs about $20. When it fails, your compressor keeps trying to start, overheats, and burns out - that's a $2,500-$4,000 repair. Warning signs: AC hums but doesn't start, takes forever to cool, or randomly shuts off. Capacitors typically last 10-20 years but Arizona heat kills them faster. During your tune-up, we test capacitor strength and replace it before failure.
